trans-unit.source: A binding terminal that represents the flow of data out of an activity.
An <xref:System.Activities.OutArgument%601> is used to flow data out of an activity.
If the activity is the root activity of a workflow, then it is also used to flow data out of the workflow to the workflow host.
In this example, a custom `Divide` activity that has two input arguments and one output argument is used as the root activity of a workflow.
The host application passes two values into the workflow and then retrieves the result of the division after the workflow completes.
[!code-csharp[CFX_WorkflowInvokerExample#20](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/cfx_workflowinvokerexample/cs/program.cs#20)]
The `Divide` activity uses arguments to receive the input values and to provide the computed result values.

The `Remainder` <xref:System.Activities.OutArgument%601> is used to pass out the remainder of the division, and the <xref:System.Activities.Activity%601.Result%2A> output argument provided by <xref:System.Activities.Activity%601> derived activities is used to pass out the quotient.

If your custom activity is derived from the generic <xref:System.Activities.CodeActivity%601> with an <xref:System.Int32> as its generic type argument, when you invoke the activity with the <xref:System.Activities.WorkflowInvoker> Invoke method, it returns an <xref:System.Int32> value.

In Addition, the <xref:System.Activities.CodeActivity%601.Execute%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method will return an <xref:System.Int32> value instead of `void` and you do not need to set a return value.
[!code-csharp[CFX_WorkflowApplicationExample#120](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/cfx_workflowapplicationexample/cs/program.cs#120)]
The data type of the <xref href="System.Activities.OutArgument`1"></xref>.
Initialize a new instance of the <xref href="System.Activities.OutArgument`1"></xref> class using default values.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Activities.OutArgument`1"></xref> class using the specified <xref href="System.Activities.Activity`1"></xref>.
The value of the argument.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Activities.OutArgument`1"></xref> class using the specified <xref href="System.Activities.DelegateArgument"></xref>.
The value of the argument.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Activities.OutArgument`1"></xref> class using the specified <xref href="System.Activities.Variable"></xref>.
The value of the argument.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Activities.OutArgument`1"></xref> class using the specified expression.
The value of the argument.
Gets an <xref href="System.Activities.Activity`1"></xref> that represents the value of this <xref href="System.Activities.OutArgument`1"></xref>.
An activity that represents the value of the argument.
Initializes and returns a new <xref href="System.Activities.OutArgument`1"></xref> constructed using the specified <xref href="System.Activities.DelegateArgument"></xref>.
The value of the argument.
The new argument.
Initializes and returns a new <xref href="System.Activities.OutArgument`1"></xref> constructed using the specified <xref href="System.Activities.Activity`1"></xref>.
The value of the argument,
The new argument.
Initializes and returns a new <xref href="System.Activities.OutArgument`1"></xref> constructed using the specified <xref href="System.Activities.Variable"></xref>.
The value of the argument.
The new argument.
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Activities.OutArgument`1"></xref> using the specified activity context.
The current activity context.
The value of the argument.
Gets the location of the value for the <xref href="System.Activities.OutArgument`1"></xref>.
The activity context that contains the value of the variable.
A reference to the location where the value of the argument is stored.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.Activities.OutArgument`1"></xref> using the specified activity context.
The current activity context.
The new value.
